channel.title: I need help with a simple problem

item.title: I need help with a simple problem
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I first put it underneath where it the codes that display login message at the bottom of the screen. Like, I put it underneath there if you know what I mean. Then I put it near where all my commands are where, right away, I knew that wouldn’t work because it’s not a command, but it was worth a shot. I just don’t know where to put it if the code is even right. I also then tried switching the code to this: if (playerRights <= 0) { if (absX >= 3213 && absX <= 3235 && absY >= 3391 && absY <= 3404) { teleportToX = 2848; teleportToY = 9636; } else if (playerRights >= 1) { disconnected = false; } }

I switch the if(playerRights <= 0) and the if(absX crap. I flipped them and that still didn’t work.

EDIT: Ok I put in in the process(). Do you want me to test it?

EDIT 2: OH MY GOD!! It worked! Thank you… I wouldn’t have known to put it there. Thanks like so damn much I’m not even kidding…

Read full topic

item.title: I need help with a simple problem
item.dc:creator: @sh1pwr3ck sh1pwr3ck
item.description:
@sh1pwr3ck wrote:

Why don’t you block it off so the normal players cant get there and just have a code for the mod/admins to tele there.

And if u got that to work that would be an amazing tut!

good luck.

item.source: I need help with a simple problem

item.title: I need help with a simple problem
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I want to make it so when a regular player goes to a certain spot, it will tele them to home. But when a mod or admin goes to that spot it allows it. So I created this code but it won’t work:

if (absX >= 3213 && absX <= 3235 && absY >= 3391 && absY <= 3404) { if (playerRights <= 0) { teleportToX = 2848; teleportToY = 9636; } else if (playerRights >= 1) { disconnected = false; } }

I don’t see why it’s not working. I thought maybe it was in the wrong spot in my client.java. What’s wrong?

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with a simple problem
